newsitem.title: NIGERIA: Nigerian refineries working at 75 pct-oil official.
newsitem.headline: Nigerian refineries working at 75 pct-oil official.

text.p: Nigeria's four refineries are now operating at 75 percent of their installed capacity, a senior oil ministry official said on Wednesday.
"Our refineries are improving in operations and the average performance is 75 percent in capacity," Wilson Dublin-Green, director of petroleum resources, told reporters in Lagos.
He said the country's biggest refinery in southeastern Port-Harcourt recorded the highest level of performance, hitting 80 percent level of its 150,000 barrels per day (bpd) capacity.
"But we have insisted that the quality of operation should be more than that."

Poor management and lack of funds to buy spare parts for repairs had reduced production level of the four refineries to about a third of their combined total capacity of 445,000 bpd in the first half of this year.
